page.title: 06A HILL FARM IN LYDFORD
page.content: This is a farm of 270acres run by the farmer and one part time helper. It is all grazing land except for some hayfields and there are three barns for storing mainly bought straw and hay and for wintering the stock. About 400 Blackface Suffolk and Cheviot sheep are kept for wool and for lambs which are sold at Market. Seventy Galloway Hereford crosses and Angus Friesian crosses are kept for raising calves which will be sold for fattening after two years. The land rises to about 1000 ft. and trees, hedges and gorse are used to provide shelter in bad weather. Not much machinery is needed as there is no cultivation. There is mains water and several springs and streams but no electricity, so shearing is done with power from generators.
